intro: Agathisanthemum angolense, commonly known as the Angola daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and has hairy stems and leaves. Its flowers are yellow with a central disk, and it produces small, dry fruits called achenes. Agathisanthemum angolense is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
